SIMSSNR 1.0.0 documentation

SSNRCalculator module

«  SSNRBasedFiltering module   ::   Contents   ::   ShapesGenerator module  »

SSNRCalculator module¶

SSNRCalculator.py

This module contains classes for calculating the (image-independent) spectral signal-to-noise ratio (SSNR) for a given system optical system and illumination.

Mathematical details will be provided in the later documentation versions and in the corresponding papers.

class SSNRCalculator.SSNRBase(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for SSNR calculators.

optical_system¶

OpticalSystem object, the optical system used in the experiment.

ssnri¶

numpy.ndarray, the spectral signal-to-noise ratio (SSNR) image.

ring_average_ssnri(number_of_samples=None)[source]¶

Computes the ring-averaged SSNR.

compute_ssnri_volume(factor=10, volume_element=1)[source]¶

Computes the SSNR volume.

compute_ssnri_entropy(factor=100)[source]¶

Computes the SSNR entropy.

compute_radial_ssnri_entropy(factor=100)[source]¶

Computes the radial SSNR entropy.

compute_full_ssnr(object_ft)[source]¶

Computes the full SSNR for a given object Fourier transform.
